intro: Eucharis ipariensis, commonly known as the Amazonian night lily, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant white flowers that bloom at night. The plant features broad, waxy leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It thrives in warm, humid environments with indirect light and well-draining soil. Eucharis ipariensis is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its elegant appearance and unique blooming pattern.
